result.execSummary:
The defendant Linda J. Mayr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: DNA sample to be provided.  Payment of restitution to Clerk of Courts Office once determined.  ALL COURT ORDERED OBLIGATIONS TO BE PAID THROUGH CLERK OF COURTS WITHIN 60 DAYS OR SET UP PAYMENT ARRANGEMENTS.

2:01 PM Defendant Linda J. Mayr in court.  Attorney Kathryn E Hayes in court for Linda J. Mayr.  Prosecuting attorney Natalia J Gess in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Hayes notes they are ready to proceed w/the exception of restitution in which they'd like a restitution hearing.  Court will proceed.  State states the joint recommendations.  Atty Hayes and DE are in agreement.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  DE pleads NC to counts 1 and 2.  Court questions DE on pleas/accepts/finds DE guilty.  Parties review VIS.  State makes statement.  Atty Hayes makes statement on behalf of DE.  DE makes statement.  Court sentences.

Ct 1:  NC ***Amended to Misd. Theft***
Ct 2:  NC
